Module lanej.schedulingsystem
Package lanej.schedulingsystem.controller

Class CustomersAppointments

java.lang.Object
lanej.schedulingsystem.controller.CustomersAppointments
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomersAppointments extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller class for displaying and managing the customers and appointments scene.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jonathan lane

  • Method Details

    • addCustomerButton

      public void addCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the add customer button is clicked. Takes the user to the scene for adding a customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • updateCustomerButton

      public void updateCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the update customer button is clicked. Takes the user to the scene for updating a customer after setting CustomerForm.customerToModify to the user's selected customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • deleteCustomerButton

      public void deleteCustomerButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the delete customer button is clicked. Confirms that the user wants the customer to be deleted, because it will also make all the appointments for that customer also be deleted (due to the aptly set Foreign Key constraints in the database). Checks to make sure the user actually has a customer selected before trying to delete any.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • addAppointmentButton

      public void addAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the add customer button is clicked. Takes the user to the scene for adding an appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • updateAppointmentButton

      public void updateAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the add customer button is clicked. Takes the user to the scene for modifying an appointment after passing the user's selected appointment into the AppointmentForm.appointmentToModify variable.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • deleteAppointmentButton

      public void deleteAppointmentButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the delete appointment button is clicked. Checks to make sure the user actually has a customer selected before trying to delete any.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • logoutButton

      public void logoutButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Takes the user back to the log-in screen again after clearing the SchedulingApplication.loggedInUser variable.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller and sets up the necessary configurations. The lambda expression used for cell factories provides a concise way to override the updateItem method, which is essential for custom rendering of table cells. Leveraging lambdas in this manner makes the code more readable by highlighting the logic directly within the context of the method call.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The URL used to initialize the controller.
      resourceBundle - The ResourceBundle used to initialize the controller.

    • weekFilterSelected

      public void weekFilterSelected()
      Filters the appointment table to only display appointments scheduled within the current week. The lambda expression provides a concise way to define the filtering logic for the list. Using lambdas in this manner centralizes and simplifies the logic for filtering the list, making it easier to understand.

    • monthFilterSelected

      public void monthFilterSelected()
      Filters the appointment table to only display appointments scheduled within the current month. The lambda expression provides a concise way to define the filtering logic for the list. Using lambdas in this manner centralizes and simplifies the logic for filtering the list, making it easier to understand.

    • allFilterSelected

      public void allFilterSelected()
      Removes all filters from the appointment table, displaying all appointments.

    • reportsButton

      public void reportsButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the event when the reports button is clicked by taking the user to the scene with a variety of reports regarding the application's data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggered by the button click.
